description: API returns 200 OK instead of 401 Unauthorized for invalid credentials
expectedBehavior: Should return 401 Unauthorized with error message when invalid credentials are provided
notes: Incorrect HTTP status code violates REST standards and represents a security concern. Successful authentication and failed authentication should have different status codes.

description: API returns 500 Internal Server Error when required fields are missing instead of 400 Bad Request
expectedBehavior: Should return 400 Bad Request with validation error specifying which required field is missing
notes: Missing validation for required fields. Poor error handling - server error instead of validation error. Affects all required booking fields.

description: Weak type validation allows invalid data types or returns 500 error
expectedBehavior: Should return 400 Bad Request with clear type validation error when invalid data types are provided
actualBehavior: Either accepts invalid types or returns 500 Internal Server Error
notes: Type validation is weak or missing. Should validate that totalPrice is number, depositPaid is boolean, bookingDates is object, names are strings, etc.

description: API accepts negative price values which violates business logic
expectedBehavior: Should return 400 Bad Request - price must be positive number
actualBehavior: Accepts negative values or returns 500 error
notes: Business logic violation - negative prices don't make sense in booking context. Represents financial integrity issue.

description: API may accept bookings where checkout date is before checkin date
expectedBehavior: Should return 400 Bad Request - checkout must be after or equal to checkin
notes: Business logic validation missing for date relationships. Booking cannot end before it starts.

description: API accepts empty strings for required name fields
expectedBehavior: Should return 400 Bad Request - firstname and lastname cannot be empty
actualBehavior: Returns 200 OK and creates booking with empty strings
notes: Validation bypass - empty strings should not be allowed for required fields. Data quality issue.

description: API returns 405 Method Not Allowed instead of 404 Not Found for non-existing resources
expectedBehavior: Should return 404 Not Found when attempting to update/patch/delete a booking that doesn't exist
notes: Incorrect HTTP status code. 405 means the method is not allowed for the resource, but 404 means resource not found. Affects PUT, PATCH, and DELETE operations.

description: API returns 201 Created instead of 204 No Content for successful DELETE operations
expectedBehavior: Should return 204 No Content for successful deletion (or 200 OK with confirmation message)
notes: Incorrect HTTP status code. 201 is for resource creation, not deletion. Should be 204 No Content or 200 OK.

description: Username field incorrectly highlighted when only password is missing
expectedBehavior: When user provides valid username without password, only the password field should be highlighted with error styling and error icon
actualBehavior: Both username and password fields are highlighted with error styling and error icons
notes: This creates confusion for users as it incorrectly suggests the username field also has an error when it contains valid data. The error message correctly states 'Password is required' but the visual feedback is misleading.

description: Password field incorrectly highlighted when only username is missing
expectedBehavior: When user provides valid password without username, only the username field should be highlighted with error styling and error icon
actualBehavior: Both username and password fields are highlighted with error styling and error icons
notes: This creates confusion for users as it incorrectly suggests the password field also has an error when it contains valid data. The error message correctly states 'Username is required' but the visual feedback is misleading.

description: Twitter social link uses outdated twitter.com URL instead of x.com
expectedBehavior: Twitter link should point to https://x.com/saucelabs (new Twitter/X domain)
actualBehavior: Twitter link points to https://twitter.com/saucelabs (old domain)
notes: Twitter rebranded to X and changed domain from twitter.com to x.com. While twitter.com still redirects, the canonical URL should be updated to x.com for consistency.

description: Terms of Service link is missing from footer despite being mentioned in copyright text
expectedBehavior: Footer should contain a clickable 'Terms of Service' link as referenced in the copyright notice
actualBehavior: Copyright text mentions 'Terms of Service' but no clickable link element exists
notes: The copyright text includes 'Terms of Service | Privacy Policy' but these are not implemented as clickable links. This creates inconsistency and prevents users from accessing important legal documentation.

description: Privacy Policy link is missing from footer despite being mentioned in copyright text
expectedBehavior: Footer should contain a clickable 'Privacy Policy' link as referenced in the copyright notice
actualBehavior: Copyright text mentions 'Privacy Policy' but no clickable link element exists
notes: The copyright text includes 'Terms of Service | Privacy Policy' but these are not implemented as clickable links. This creates inconsistency and prevents users from accessing important legal documentation.

description: Product title displays incorrect value for one product card
expectedBehavior: Product card should display 'Sauce Labs T-Shirt (Red)' as the title
actualBehavior: Product card displays 'Test.allTheThings() T-Shirt (Red)' as the title
notes: One product card consistently shows wrong title. This appears to be a data issue where the wrong product name is mapped to the product. Affects product listing, cart, and product detail pages.

description: Product description displays incorrect value for one product card
expectedBehavior: Product card should display correct product description matching the product
actualBehavior: Product card displays 'carry.allTheThings() with the sleek, streamlined Sly Pack that melds uncompromising style with unequaled laptop and tablet protection.' which doesn't match the product
notes: One product card consistently shows wrong description. This appears to be a data issue where the wrong description is mapped to the product. The description text uses unconventional naming pattern (carry.allTheThings()) suggesting test data.

description: Floating-point precision error in checkout price calculation causes incorrect total display
expectedBehavior: Price calculations should handle floating-point arithmetic correctly with proper rounding to 2 decimal places
actualBehavior: When multiple items are added to cart, the subtotal may have floating-point precision errors (e.g., 95.97000000000001 instead of 95.97)
notes: This is a common JavaScript floating-point arithmetic issue. The application should implement proper decimal handling (e.g., using toFixed(2) or a decimal library) to prevent precision errors in financial calculations. While the display may round correctly, the underlying calculation can still cause comparison failures in automated tests.

description: Checkout button remains enabled when cart is empty
expectedBehavior: Checkout button should be disabled when no items are in the cart to prevent users from proceeding to checkout with empty cart
actualBehavior: Checkout button is enabled and clickable even when cart has no items
notes: This is a UX issue that allows users to attempt checkout with an empty cart, which may lead to errors or confusion in the checkout flow. The button should be disabled (or hidden) when cart is empty.

description: Reset App State functionality does not reset product Add/Remove button states on inventory page
expectedBehavior: After clicking Reset App State, all product buttons should be reset to 'Add to cart' state, removing the cart badge and clearing cart contents
actualBehavior: Cart badge is removed and cart is cleared, but product buttons on inventory page remain in 'Remove' state instead of changing back to 'Add to cart'
notes: This creates inconsistent state where the cart is empty (badge gone) but UI shows products as added (Remove buttons). Users cannot add products again without a page reload. This is a state management issue in the Reset App State functionality.

description: Backtrace API throws unauthorized error when navigating to social media links from footer
expectedBehavior: Social media links should navigate to external pages without throwing JavaScript errors
actualBehavior: Clicking footer social links (LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook) triggers uncaught exception from Backtrace API (error reporting service) with 401 Unauthorized error
notes: The error appears to be related to the Backtrace error reporting service not having proper credentials configured. While this doesn't prevent navigation, it causes uncaught exceptions that would normally fail tests. Test refactored to validate link attributes (href, target) instead of performing actual navigation to external sites, which is more reliable and avoids external dependencies. The bug remains in the application but is no longer relevant for testing purposes.
